meanings.definition: Telfered (verb): past tense of telfer - to steal or pilfer
meanings.sent1: He telfered some cookies from the jar.
meanings.sent2: The thief telfered money from the cash register.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon telfered the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes telfered a glance at the tempting display.
meanings.sent5: The pirate telfered treasures from the sunken ship.

meanings.definition: Telfered (adjective): having been stolen or pilfered
meanings.sent1: The telfered jewels were found hidden in the attic.
meanings.sent2: The detective recovered the telfered painting.
meanings.sent3: The cat proudly carried the telfered fish in its mouth.
meanings.sent4: The telfered goods were returned to the rightful owner.
meanings.sent5: The telfered car parts were sold in the black market.
